messages.subject: Re: the things kids say
messages.msgSnippet: Okay, just had to share these two. My funnies from yesterday are: Mackenzie (6), describing a Batman action figure that has more elaborate clothing than the
messages.messageBody:
Okay, just had to share these two. My funnies from yesterday are:

Mackenzie (6), describing a Batman action figure that has more elaborate
clothing than the others: "Mom, this Batman has been upgraded. You know what
upgraded means, don't you mom?"

And after (very reluctantly) leaving a pizza parlor with some new video
games he hadn't seen before: "With me and video games, it's like I'm a super
electro magnet, and the video games are like a giant refridgerator, I just
get sucked on and can't get away."

Blue Skies!
-Robin-

messages.subject: Re: the things kids say
messages.msgSnippet: Julie, Thanks for posting that.  I certianly enjoyed hearing that through all this craziness..LOL!  We had such a non-traditional day and I was so happy being
messages.messageBody:
Julie,

Thanks for posting that. I certianly enjoyed hearing that through
all this craziness..LOL! We had such a non-traditional day and I was
so happy being Mom to my boys today. My 4 yo ds just played the
Harry Potter game for the first time without dad and from the
beginning! He caught the snitch, even his dad (our video game stud
around here) could not do it! He is showing more confidence lately
and we are so proud of him. He would always say "I can't" or "I
don't know how" and we were so frustrated in how to motivate him to
try. I do not know if it is the unschooling, but I am truely
appreciating many more parts of my life! Good grief I let the baby
nap til 8 and they just went to bed at 11!! But that was what worked
today, and they are happy.

Olga :)
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "Julie Solich"
<mjsolich@i...> wrote:
> This morning my boys told me I was more like an angel than a mum.
LOL
> Jacob went on to explain that if he took all the love out of an
angel and then took me apart and then put it all together, he would
have me!
>
> They are the best!
>
> They are outside at the moment playing with their enormous dinosaur
collection. They have enough to have a herd of herbivores for the
carnivores to attack (which they do on a regular basis).
>
> They even have dead carcasses courtesy of our dog who chewed the
heads and tails of a few he found lying around!
>
> I love unschooling! My kids LOVE unschooling! Thanks for the
encouragement everyone!
>
> Julie
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: the things kids say
messages.msgSnippet: This morning my boys told me I was more like an angel than a mum. LOL Jacob went on to explain that if he took all the love out of an angel and then took me
messages.messageBody:
This morning my boys told me I was more like an angel than a mum. LOL
Jacob went on to explain that if he took all the love out of an angel and then took me apart and then put it all together, he would have me!

They are the best!

They are outside at the moment playing with their enormous dinosaur collection. They have enough to have a herd of herbivores for the carnivores to attack (which they do on a regular basis).

They even have dead carcasses courtesy of our dog who chewed the heads and tails of a few he found lying around!

I love unschooling! My kids LOVE unschooling! Thanks for the encouragement everyone!

Julie

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
